oneOf.description: a string containing the link's URL

href.description: a string containing the link's URL

relationshipToOne.description: reference to other resource in a to-one relationship

relationshipLinks.description: optional references to other resource objects

relationshipToMany.description: An array of objects each containing the 'type' and 'id' for to-many relationships

pointer.description: A [JSON Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901) to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. `/data` for a primary data object, or `/data/attributes/title` for a specific attribute.

parameter.description: A string indicating which query parameter caused the error.

type.description: The [type](https://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-object-identification) member is used to describe resource objects that share common attributes and relationships.

id.description: Each resource object’s type and id pair MUST [identify](https://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-object-identification) a single, unique resource.

xmlBackupFile.description: the original xml as backup to restore the xml field.

accessConstraints.description: access constraints for the given resource.

fees.description: Costs and of terms of use for the given resource.

dateStamp.description: date that the metadata was created. If this is a metadata record which is parsed from remote iso metadata, the date stamp of the remote iso metadata will be used.

fileIdentifier.description: the parsed file identifier from the iso metadata xml (gmd:fileIdentifier) OR for example if it is a layer/featuretypethe uuid of the described layer/featuretype shall be used to identify the generated iso metadata xml.

origin.description: Where the metadata record comes from.

originUrl.description: the url of the document where the information of this metadata record comes from

title.description: a short descriptive title for this metadata

abstract.description: brief summary of the content of this metadata.

isCustomized.description: If the metadata record is customized, this flag is True

isSearchable.description: only searchable metadata will be returned from the search api

hits.description: how many times this metadata was requested by a client

isActive.description: Used to activate/deactivate the service. If it is deactivated, you cant request the service through the Mr. Map proxy.

version.description: the version of the service type as sem version

serviceUrl.description: the base url of the service

xmlBackupFile.description: the original xml as backup to restore the xml field.

dateStamp.description: date that the metadata was created. If this is a metadata record which is parsed from remote iso metadata, the date stamp of the remote iso metadata will be used.

fileIdentifier.description: the parsed file identifier from the iso metadata xml (gmd:fileIdentifier) OR for example if it is a layer/featuretypethe uuid of the described layer/featuretype shall be used to identify the generated iso metadata xml.

origin.description: Where the metadata record comes from.

originUrl.description: the url of the document where the information of this metadata record comes from

title.description: a short descriptive title for this metadata

abstract.description: brief summary of the content of this metadata.

isCustomized.description: If the metadata record is customized, this flag is True

isSearchable.description: only searchable metadata will be returned from the search api

hits.description: how many times this metadata was requested by a client

isActive.description: Used to activate/deactivate the service. If it is deactivated, you cant request the service through the Mr. Map proxy.

identifier.description: this is a string which identifies the element on the remote service.

isQueryable.description: flag to signal if this layer provides factual information or not. Parsed from capabilities.

isOpaque.description: flag to signal if this layer support transparency content or not. Parsed from capabilities.

isCascaded.description: WMS cascading allows to expose layers coming from other WMS servers as if they were local layers

name.description: The style's Name is used in the Map request STYLES parameter to lookup the style on server side.

title.description: The Title is a human-readable string as an alternative for the name attribute.

description.description: a short description what this allowed operation controls.

bboxLatLon.description: bounding box shall be supplied regardless of what CRS the map server may support, but it may be approximate if the data are not natively in geographic coordinates. The purpose of bounding box is to facilitate geographic searches without requiring coordinate transformations by the search engine.

layerScaleMin.description: minimum scale for a possible request to this layer. If the request is out of the given scope, the service will response with empty transparentimages. None value means no restriction.

layerScaleMax.description: maximum scale for a possible request to this layer. If the request is out of the given scope, the service will response with empty transparentimages. None value means no restriction.

previewImage.description: A preview image for the Map Context Layer

charset.description: The charset which is used by the stored data.

inspireTopConsistence.description: Flag to signal if the described data has a topologically consistence.

datasetIdCodeSpace.description: code space for the given identifier

statusCode.description: The http status code of the response

isSuperuser.description: Designates that this user has all permissions without explicitly assigning them.

username.description: Required. 150 characters or fewer. Letters, digits and @/./+/-/_ only.

isStaff.description: Designates whether the user can log into this admin site.

isActive.description: Designates whether this user should be treated as active. Unselect this instead of deleting accounts.

confirmedDsgvo.description: I understand and accept that my data will be automatically processed and securely stored, as it is stated in the general data protection regulation (GDPR).

taskId.description: Celery ID for the Task that was run

taskName.description: Name of the Task which was run

taskArgs.description: JSON representation of the positional arguments used with the task

taskKwargs.description: JSON representation of the named arguments used with the task

status.description: Current state of the task being run

contentType.description: Content type of the result data

contentEncoding.description: The encoding used to save the task result data

dateCreated.description: Datetime field when the task result was created in UTC

dateDone.description: Datetime field when the task was completed in UTC

traceback.description: Text of the traceback if the task generated one

username.description: Required. 150 characters or fewer. Letters, digits and @/./+/-/_ only.
